events.name: Broadcast IP Inter-Op Lab Day 1
events.description:
The aim of the Broadcast IP Inter-Op Lab is to show what is working in IP today and highlight interoperability between different manufacturers. The IP Lab will include a live broadcast studio, content editing and distribution to OTT, all IP in real time.
the IP Lab is a golden opportunity for Asian broadcasters and production houses to pre-book free hands-on sessions at the IP Lab during the show. We will provide cameras for you to shoot a short video clip in the halls and then return to the lab at your scheduled 45-minute session to ingest, edit and stream your content onto screens around the exhibition halls and beyond.
Participating companies are expected to send a team of 3-5 representatives preferably from the relevant departments: Content Creation, Content Editing and Distribution.
Come to BroadcastAsia2017 — and see, shoot & share!
Terms & conditions: 
- By participating, you have agreed that Asia-Pacific Broadcasting (APB) may use the information for sending marketing and promotional materials to you. APB may also share the information among partner companies in order to offer information we think may be of interest to you.
- Attendance is strictly by invitation only. APB reserves the right to reject the registration of any participant whom APB deems no suitable. 
- This is not a Visitor registration site to enter BroadcastAsia. Participants are required to register for their visitor pass for BroadcastAsia separately before they are allowed to enter the exibition.
- In view of limited time-slots, registration will be on a first-come, first-served basis.
events.group_name: Asia-Pacific Broadcasting, BroadcastAsia2017(UBM SES) & Ideal Systems

events.name: Malaysia Digital Hub & Malaysia Tech Entrepreneur Programme
events.description:
GROW & EXPAND!
Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC) is embarking on a new platform to certify populated co-working locations with the right ecosystem network of funding availability, venture builders, talent development and technology from key anchor internet companies, where known as “Malaysia Digital Hub”. This initiative is owned by the industry and driven by the community, it is the place for growing startups to setup and connect with the rich ecosystem to develop their next big idea in technology and go regionally.

Join us for a short session to understand how you can grow and expand your digital business in ASEAN!

events.name: Exploring Organisation and Relationship Systems Coaching for Teams
events.description:
No person is an island. We are all part of complex systems such as families, business partnerships, teams, organisations and communities. They are like spider webs; touch one strand and the whole structure moves. This is a key tenet of Systems Theory. Learn some of the tools that may be applied into the world of an Agile / Scrum.Join Elfarina Zaid from ORSC for an experiential evening exploring the relationship systems intelligence to Team Management and Team Coaching.  About the speaker: Elfarina Zaid is the Director of Elf Coaching, a boutique leadership firm founded in 2009 aimed at
engaging executives and multinational organisations to create innovative, learning cultures to lead with purpose in Asia. Elf Coaching is a partner with CRR Global - responsible for managing ORSC™ programmes in Singapore & Malaysia under CRR Singapore. Today, CRR Global is represented in 25 countries. Elfarina Zaid is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and an Accredited Partnership Broker. She is a Faculty member of Coaches Training Institute (CTI) and an Associate Coach with the Civil Service College.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: May Meetup
events.description:
Hi friends! We're thrilled to have another ReactJS Singapore meetup in May.   Agenda  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks • 'Introduction to RxJs' by Warren Mira • 'Data Visualization with React and D3' by Yaohong Ch'ng • 'Testing React Components with Enzyme' by Joseph Matthias Goh  Information for Attendees > Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security! The meetup will be held at DBS Asia X, Sandcrawler Building #07-03 at 1 Fusionopolis View. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is CC23 One-North. 


Job Opportunities  • Refuel4 is hiring a Senior UX Engineer • AMaaS is hiring ReactJS Developers • Teode is hiring ReactJS freelancers Have a job position you'd like to announce? Contact us and we'll post it here.  


Sponsors  Massive thanks to DBS Asia X for hosting our event!
events.location: DBS Asia X (DAX), Sandcrawler Building - 1 Fusionopolis View, #07-03, Singapore 138577

events.name: Let's talk about BIM usecases & AEC painpoint from Tech standpoint
events.description: This is a group for anyone that is developing or interested in developing hardware or software solution for AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction) industry. We started this group to meet other people that interested in creating BIM software, applying data science, deep learning on top of BIM or applying VR/AR, IOT, drone tech or other emerging technology to AEC industry. Agenda: 7.15pm - Current pain point in AEC industries [Rexter Retana from RSP] 7.45pm - Virtual Singapore [Sonny ANDALIS from BCA] 8.15pm - Start the discussion

events.description: Learn about gemmology quality and value factors for all types of gems and precious stones.
